Why does SFT often cause models to misus: Over-interprets instructions and forces incorrect assumptions
The three components of ToolRL's reward: Format, Tool Name Match, Parameter Match
Why does GRPO normalize rewards per-quer: To prevent unstable gradients when reward scales vary across queries
In LOOP's Leave-One-Out advantage calcul: the average of all other trajectories in the group
Why does LOOP use token-level rewards in: To link generation and rewards in single feedback loop for stable learning
Why does Reflexion avoid gradient-based: Uses verbal feedback through prompts instead of parameter updates
Why does HotpotQA benefit more from insi: Reasoning-intensive tasks need abstract guidance for synthesis across sources
The advantage of internalization methods: Experiences embedded in parameters enable direct application without retrieval
The advantage of externalization methods: No parameter updates needed; flexible memory reuse across tasks
